solution_line_template: He earn ${refurb_tshirt_price} x {refurb_tshirt_sold} = $<<{refurb_tshirt_price}*{refurb_tshirt_sold}={refurb_tshirt_income}>>{refurb_tshirt_income} for the refurbished T-shirt.
He can earn ${tshirt_price} x {tshirt_sold} = $<<{tshirt_price}*{tshirt_sold}={tshirt_income}>>{tshirt_income} for the T-shirts.
He can earn ${pants_price} x {pants_sold} = $<<{pants_price}*{pants_sold}={pants_income}>>{pants_income} for the pants.
He can earn ${skirt_price} x {skirt_sold} = $<<{skirt_price}*{skirt_sold}={skirt_income}>>{skirt_income} for the skirts.

Therefore Karl can earn a total of ${refurb_tshirt_income} + ${tshirt_income} + ${pants_income} + ${skirt_income} = $<<{refurb_tshirt_income}+{tshirt_income}+{pants_income}+{skirt_income}={total_income}>>{total_income}.
